summary: This bill, the TRICARE OBGYN Treatment and Access without Lags in Care Act (TOTAL Care Act), aims to improve access to obstetrical and gynecological care for TRICARE Prime beneficiaries. It mandates the Secretary of Defense to establish a five-year pilot program allowing female beneficiaries to access OBGYN care without referrals and permitting them to designate an OBGYN provider as an additional primary care manager. The Secretary is required to submit a report assessing the pilot program's impact on enrollment, costs, and other relevant factors to the congressional defense committees.
